p: Authority draws from formalized institutions and organizations at different scales, legitimacy and claims to make decisions about environmental governance, as well as, informal institutions claims over resource governance [ 4]. The intertwining of productive and repressive aspects of power is key to understanding the relationship between power, subjectivity and agency [ 27]. Power can thus be enacted either as a tool for domination or emancipation [ 27, 28], with consequences on social differentiation [ 29].
